intro: Cardiospermum barbicaule, commonly known as the horse chestnut or velvet bean, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Bombacaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds covered in a fleshy, edible aril. It is often grown for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. The plant's unique botanical features make it a notable species in both horticulture and ecological studies.
